labels.analysis: The MCP Server primarily functions as a file conversion tool, specifically designed to convert Excel (both .xls and .xlsx) and Apple Numbers (.numbers) files into PDF format. The server integrates with AI assistants to allow users to initiate conversions through conversational interfaces, enhancing accessibility and productivity. Security and ease of installation are highlighted features, ensuring user-friendly and safe file handling.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "File Management" is chosen because the server's core functionality revolves around file operations (conversion). "Daily Productivity" is selected as a secondary label due to the server's aim to streamline document sharing and workflow efficiency through AI-assisted conversion. "API Integration" can also be considered relevant if the AI assistants are accessed via APIs, but it is less central. A custom label is not necessary as the predefined labels adequately capture the server's functionality.

tools.name: convert_excel_to_pdf
tools.description: Converts Excel files (.xls, .xlsx) to PDF format

input_path.description: Relative path to the Excel file (.xls, .xlsx) to convert

output_format.description: Output format (currently only PDF is supported)

tools.name: convert_numbers_to_pdf
tools.description: Converts Apple Numbers files (.numbers) to PDF format

input_path.description: Relative path to the Numbers file (.numbers) to convert

output_format.description: Output format (currently only PDF is supported)

server_info_crawled.overview: Convert your Excel and Apple Numbers files to PDF format seamlessly. Integrate with AI assistants to enable file conversion directly through conversation, making document sharing effortless. Enjoy secure file handling and easy installation to enhance your productivity.

tools.name: convert_excel_to_pdf

input_path.description: Relative path to the Excel file (.xls, .xlsx) to convert

output_format.description: Output format (currently only PDF is supported)

tools.name: convert_numbers_to_pdf
tools.description: Converts Apple Numbers files (.numbers) to PDF format

output_format.description: Output format (currently only PDF is supported)

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@kmexnx/excel-to-pdf-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
